author: Daily Mail
title: Ibrahima Konate relishing challenge of chasing four trophies after Liverpool defender impressed in FA Cup victory over Arsenal
text: [Ibrahima Konate](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/ibrahima-konate/index.html) said [Liverpool](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/teampages/liverpool.html) were enjoying the challenge of chasing four trophies after his impressive display in the FA Cup victory over [Arsenal](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/teampages/arsenal.html). Liverpool continue to battle on four fronts after Jakub Kiwior's own goal and a stoppage-time strike by [Luis Diaz](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/luis-diaz/index.html) sent them through to the FA Cup fourth round with a 2-0 win at Arsenal. [Jurgen Klopp](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/jurgen_klopp/index.html)'s side were without captain [Virgil van Dijk](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/virgil-van-dijk/index.html) and Mohamad Salah, but after they were able to ride their luck in north London, stand-in skipper [Trent Alexander-Arnold](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/trent-alexander-arnold/index.html)'s excellent late cross forced the opener and Diaz was able to wrap up a hard-fought victory with a powerful late finish.

author: 13WMAZ Staff
title: Man convicted in Houston County of child molestation | 13wmaz.com
text: HOUSTON COUNTY, Ga. â€” A 57-year-old man will spend the next 30 years in prison after being convicted on aggravated child molestation charges in Houston County, according to a press release from the [Houston County District Attorney's Office.](https://www.houstoncountyga.org/government/district-attorney.cms) Eugene Charles Flaute was convicted Wednesday after a two-day trial, the district attorney's office says. The press release said Flaute was accused of "multiple incidents of sexual abuse performed on a child over an extended period of time." "People like this have no place in society, we are pleased with the conviction and sentence, but know we cannot undo what has been done," District Attorney Will Kendall said in the release. "At the end of the day, we must protect our children, safeguard them and protect them from the evil in the world." Flaute was sentenced by Judge Katherine Lumsden to 30 years in prison followed by life on probation, the release said. They note that he is not eligible for parole, and he will be subject to the conditions of probation for sex offenders. The case was prosecuted by Assistant District Attorneys Justin C Duane and Brian J. Huckaby. In the media release, Duane emphasized how child sexual abuse is "an unfortunate reality but a reality," saying that sexual abuse happens more often than people understand. "Any day that we can remove a sexual predator from our community is a great day," Daune said in the release. "I am grateful that the jury held the defendant accountable for his disgusting actions... I am glad that we were able to give the child in this case a voice." 13WMAZ+ Get more news and information from 13WMAZ by downloading our 13WMAZ+ app on our Roku and Amazon Fire Stick devices. This allows you to watch more 13WMAZ on-demand and access your favorite 13WMAZ shows like Central Georgia Focus and our More Than a Number special.

author: @Cleveland19
title: FirstEnergy announces layoffs in 5 States
text:
FirstEnergy announces layoffs in 5 States
Published: Mar. 26, 2025 at 8:05 PM EDT|Updated: seconds ago
CLEVELAND, Ohio (WOIO) - FirstEnergy is announcing that they are laying off about three percent of its workers.
The cuts are not only happening here in Ohio but in four other states, which include Pennsylvania, West Virginia, Maryland, and New Jersey.
But did say this will have a minimal impact on the front-line employees, according to a FirstEnergy spokesperson.
FirstEnergy said it remains committed to ensuring safe, reliable power for our customers, and they do not expect the organizational changes to impact its ability to maintain the electric system.
